parameters: \pop[2]Once again, Kyron requests some alone time with me.
\pop[2]I didn't have any plans for the rest of the day, so I quickly agree.
\pop[2]He stares out the window, taking in the view with a look of awe on his face.
\pop[3]I still can't get over how beautiful this city is.
Kinda makes you forget how unforgiving it can be.
\pop[2]He places his hand on the glass.
\pop[3]You know, the others keep staring at me.
I can tell they're concerned for me, after what happened.
It's understandable, but honestly, I'm doing fine.
\pop[2]I step toward the window and stand beside him.
That's part of why I feel comfortable around you.
\pop[3]Of course, New Year's Eve definitely helped.
Don't worry, we'll get to finish what we started.
\pop[3]Of course, New Year's Eve definitely helped.
I knew I could trust you with that kind of info.
\pop[2]He smiles at me, and then looks out the window once more.
\pop[3]I still need to ask Isaac about my parents, though.
Other things have just taken priority since then.
\pop[3]It's only been a day, but I'm still feeling impatient.
Have you ever felt like you \c[14]had\c[0] to know something?
\pop[3]Well take that feeling, and multiply it by a million.
It's like, the \c[14]one\c[0] fact that will make my life whole.
Who were they? What did they want to run from...?
\pop[2]I shrug. It's almost impossible for me to tell.
\pop[2]However, I doubt that the truth will make his life whole.
\pop[2]We always want and treasure what we can't obtain.
\pop[2]I do hope he's able to find out the answer, though.
\pop[2]Even if the answer was likely to be underwhelming.
\pop[2]But if anybody could help him out, it'd be Isaac.
\pop[3]If we're gonna go to \c[10]Argus\c[0]' HQ, I'll ask him beforehand.
That'll be my first, and probably \c[14]only\c[0] chance.
\pop[3]If I start to get too nervous, maybe you can help me out.
I wouldn't want to miss an opportunity like this.
\pop[2]I nod. Of course I'd help him out.
\pop[3]I'm surprised we're doing this, by the way.
But if Isaac thinks it'll go well, then I do too.
\pop[3]He's never let me down, and I doubt he'll start now.
Not when things are more important than ever.
\pop[3]I wish I could tell him to stop staring, though.
It's starting to make me all self-conscious.
\pop[3]I guess your friends think those deaths hit me hard.
It's reasonable to assume that. But honestly? I don't care.
\pop[2]He doesn't care? That seems a little cold.
\pop[3]People die all the time on the colonies.
It's a harsh life out there.
\pop[3]And even \c[14]more\c[0] people die in the city every day.
Do you put your life on pause for all of \c[14]them\c[0]?
\pop[2]But I remember he told me that people on the colony were like family.
\pop[2]I can't help but wonder if he's trying to be strong, or experiencing denial.
\pop[3]Sometimes, you just can't afford to mourn.
On the colony, when somebody dies, there's a labor gap.
We need to work harder, and make sure nothing gets disrupted.
\pop[3]That's probably why we've romanticized the stars.
We can just pay our respects before passing out after work.
Anyway, I'm getting a bit ahead of myself here.
\pop[3]I just mean to say that those deaths didn't hurt me.
In fact, I think I share the same mentality as everybody else.
The deaths only served to dig a deeper grave for \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[3]And in that case, is it truly a loss?
Or is it something that guaranteed our victory?
\pop[3]Maybe. But maybe that comes \c[14]after\c[0] we win.
If we stopped to cry right now? We'd sabotage our efforts.
Just like on the colony. We can't waste time mourning.
\pop[3]We need to do it when the time is right.
\pop[3]If we didn't have to stick by Isaac's side, I'd be out there, helping.
I could buy food for the \c[23]zeros\c[0], and help them last until Sunday.
We're \c[14]really\c[0] lucky that the others have started to step in.
\pop[3]Heh. Looks like we're on the same page as them for once.
Survive until the fifth. That's all we have to do, right?
\pop[2]I nod. Then \c[23]Hermes\c[0] can carry out whatever his plan is.
\pop[3]So I say we enjoy ourselves in the meantime...
\pop[2]He grabs the collar of my shirt and pulls me in for a kiss.
\pop[2]Our lips lock together once more, just like on New Year's Eve.
\pop[2]Taking the initiative, he starts stepping forward, making me step backwards.
\pop[2]I eventually hit the bed, and fall back onto it, looking up at Kyron.
\pop[2]He smirks and gets on top of me, sitting in my lap.
\pop[3]I \c[14]did\c[0] say we'd get to finish what we started, right?
\pop[2]He places a hand on my shoulder, pinning me down to the bed.
\pop[2]Leaning forward, we start to kiss again; and again, and again.
\pop[2]Using his free hand, I feel him start to undo his belt.
\pop[2]I feel him slide it off, and throw it on the hotel room floor.
\pop[2]A second later, he pulls back, breaking the kiss.
\pop[2]I stare up at him, and he gives me a sly smirk.
\pop[2]He reaches up to his collar, and starts to take it off, just like his belt.
\pop[2]After a brief struggle, it comes loose.
\pop[2]Throwing it aside, it hits the ground with a loud thud.
\pop[2]Then, a second later, we're kissing again.
\pop[2]I run my hands along his body, and bring them up to the top of his vest.
\pop[2]As we make out, I slowly slide it down his shoulders, and help him take it off.
\pop[2]He did say he looked better without it, didn't he?
\pop[2]I guess it was time for me to find out...
\pop[2]I must've dozed off. My eyes slowly open.
\pop[2]Rolling over in the bed, I notice Kyron standing at the window.
\pop[2]He must hear the rustling of the sheets, and he turns to look.
\pop[2]I shake my head, warding off any fatigue, before getting out of bed.
\pop[2]With a soft smile, I approach him.
\pop[2]Our bond is different now - and I'm definitely \c[14]not\c[0] complaining.
\pop[2]He turns back to the window, and places his hand on it.
\pop[2]Letting out a deep sigh, I can tell he has a lot on his mind.
\pop[3]You know, I never used to climb those trees on my own.
\pop[3]That might be the \c[14]real\c[0] reason why I'm unaffected by all this.
If anybody needs help right now? It's that poor kid.
\pop[2]Right. He's now an orphan. But the \c[23]zeros\c[0] seem like family.
\pop[2]There was no shortage of support and sympathy on display in the town square.
\pop[3]Let's just say I \c[14]know\c[0] what they're going through.
Take a look. You can see them pretty clearly.
\pop[2]I look out the window. We have a nice view of the town square.
\pop[2]We're not too high up, so I can make out all of their faces.
\pop[2]Sure enough, the child is there. Surrounded by other \c[23]zeros\c[0].
\pop[3]I think that's the only thing that can help with grief.
The sympathy of others who have experienced it as well.
\pop[2]I place my hand on his shoulder, and give it a couple consoling pats.
His name was... Well, it's not important.
Just know that he was basically my best friend.
\pop[3]When we finished work, we'd sneak away from the colony.
And like you could probably guess, we'd practice climbing.
\pop[3]He was at my side when I got the first glimpse of the city.
I was addicted to it, and asked him to go back with me almost every night.
It was how we bonded. Our \c[14]shared\c[0] desire to call the city home.
\pop[3]I didn't mention him because I was scared of opening up to you.
You know how cold my shoulder was at the start of all this, right?
\pop[3]But it's not like I was lying to you.
It's more like - I was lying to myself.
I wish I never took him up there with me.
\pop[3]I know I called him my best friend, but...
It started to turn into something more than that.
We shared our first kiss up there, and a special pledge.
\pop[2]He scoffs, and tugs at his collar.
\pop[3]The promise that \c[14]one\c[0] day, we'd live in the city together...
It was pretty romantic, even if my vision told me it would never happen.
But when your \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] is bad? Sometimes denial is part of the package.
\pop[2]He walks away from the window, and I follow him to the center of the room.
\pop[3]It was a pretty strenuous workout, climbing those trees.
And without gear, a bad fall could really do some damage.
\pop[3]I'm sure you can figure out the rest.
After that, he couldn't really walk anymore.
\pop[3]Which means he couldn't contribute to the colony.
And with how our pay works? That's a death warrant.
\pop[3]I tried my hardest, but I couldn't work enough for two people.
If I kept splitting my food with him, we'd \c[14]both\c[0] starve.
\pop[2]I can sense his sadness, and tell he's trying not to cry.
\pop[2]His ability to remain composed in the face of this is admirable.
\pop[3]So it's not the first time I've watched a \c[23]zero\c[0] starve.
What I saw in the town square was really nothing new.
\pop[3]Whether it was my friend, or that kid's parents?
We can make sure this is the \c[14]last\c[0] time.
So that's why I'm not sad. I'm \c[14]hopeful\c[0].
\pop[3]Hopeful, because for the first time, it seems like our struggle is over.
And if I keep this collar on? Then it's like he's \c[14]right\c[0] here with me.
All of a sudden, the pledge wasn't as far-fetched as I thought.
\pop[3]Anyway, thanks for listening to me, Delta.
I hate to ramble, but I thought it was pretty important.
In the face of these losses, I can't help but feel optimistic.
\pop[3]And it's a lot better to share optimism, than grief.
If all those \c[23]zeros\c[0] got phones? You'll make a \c[14]lot\c[0] more friends.
And those two people that died will go down in history. Forever.
\pop[3]We all knew there was a chance that we'd die.
But we were satisfied, because we'd die fighting for our beliefs.
And look. Now almost the entire \c[14]world\c[0] shares those beliefs.
\pop[2]He smiles, and playfully nudges my shoulder.
\pop[3]Must've felt nice to be ahead of the curve, huh?
You got front-row seats to witness everything change.
And on Sunday, we might even play a part in all of it.
\pop[2]He tilts his head toward the hotel room door.
\pop[3]Let's get back to the group, though.
I think that's all I really needed to talk about.
\pop[3]And once again, you keep on proving that you're the cool one.
I hope you don't mind if we spend more time like this together.
\i[2]"I want all the time I can get with you."
\i[2]"I want all the time I can get with you."
\i[5]"Of course. I enjoy spending time with you."
\i[5]"Of course. I enjoy spending time with you."
\pop[2]With another smile, we leave the room together.
\pop[2]I'm really glad that he chose to open up to me like that.
\pop[2]I knew I \c[14]wanted\c[0] my friends to share their stories, so this was great.
\pop[2]By the time we paid a visit to \c[10]Argus\c[0], I'd know everything there was to know.
\pop[2]And then \c[14]in\c[0] that HQ, I'd gain even \c[14]more\c[0] valuable memories.
\pop[2]Especially since I'd get to witness the master plan of \c[23]Hermes\c[0] firsthand.
\pop[2]I'm filled with both excitement, and overly cautious optimism.
\pop[2]My goal was now to use my memories in a strategic fashion...
\pop[2]To prove the worth of my friends, and the worthlessness of \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]And simply \c[14]hope\c[0] that we make it through this unscathed...
